question: Some people think that the government should establish free libraries in each town. Others believe it is a waste of money since people can access the internet at home to obtain information. Discuss both the side and give your opinion.
text: New libraries are critically important in the modern society and this subject has always been one of the most highly debated issues among the population.  A group of people is believed free-charge places are needed by human all the time. However, the other sides support that despite the accessibility of the internet, new libraries would be a waste of money for nowadays. This essay will discuss both sides of argument in depth.

To begin with, these local locations always occur many benefits for the local authority during past times and now. Many social and useful activities are implemented by community to sustain communicate each other in these areas. As an illustration, in order to using to reach loads of information, the placement maintains speaking course, manageable leisure times, and instruction courses for immigrants. In this manner, there is a big role in social developing.

It is also worth saying that, important emphasize, we would reach every data whenever we like while using the internet when we are sitting at home. Despite this reachable infrastructure, libraries are constructed in many developing countries. This occasion could cause major budget problems for the local ministry. In other words, using the constant money for other needs, such as education, homeless people, and that. Many research studies show us primary and high school students would prefer to conduct their investigations via the internet at their home.

In conclusion, it is well-known fact that a library is acceptable a status for socializing quality for a town. This essay argued that why the important and necessary public points should establish accordingly to maintain most of the benefits. In my opinion, even walking to a library is an essential activity for children and families in a town.
